description: Trees located Front & Rear with open access:- We inspected this site on 10th November 2016.T1 & T2 = 2 x Large Holly Trees growing very close to the main building. These trees appear to be causing damage to both the tarmac surface and the adjacent walls. There is also a possibility that they are causing damage to the drains close by.- Fell as close as possible to ground level.- Grind stump by up to 300mm below existing ground level.T3 = Large Camillia- Fell as close as possible to ground level.- Grind stump by up to 300mm below existing ground level.T4 = Large Acer Capillipes- Reduce crown overall by 0.5 - 1 metre, pruning back to suitable growth points. Leaving shortened selected secondary growth to form a small neater and symetrical shaped canopy.T5 = Large Catalpa Leaning on boundary wall and causing damage to the top pier of brickwork- Fell as close as possible to ground level.- Grind stump by up to 300mm below existing ground level.
